description.narrative: (Georgia): .Good Governance Initiative (GGI) is designed to support the GOG in strengthening transparency, accountability, and effectiveness of select governance and service delivery systems to achieve: improved administrative and financial management of public institutions; improved access to independent, reliable and balanced information on government performance; strengthened policy development and lawmaking; and strengthened institutional oversight of GOG. GGI's government counterparts include the Prime Minister's Office; the Ministries of Finance, Health, Justice, and Regional Development; Parliament; the State Audit Office; Public Defender's and State Inspector's Offices and select local governments. Interventions will work with government and civil society representatives to enhance public participation, public awareness and monitoring of public administration and parliamentary strengthening reforms. The activity will have emphasis on COVID19 response. ..Using FY 2019 funds, GGI's activities will be focused on:.Supporting the GoG in COVID19 response through policy research in the governance areas impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic; analysis of government operations during the pandemic; mapping of public services and developing recommendations for operationalizing essential public services to be accessible remotely; developing guidelines for the operation of civil service during the crisis; supporting remote operations of the Parliament; etc. Supporting the implementation of the Local Government Decentralization Strategy (2020-2025) by providing necessary technical assistance in select areas.Supporting the implementation of Anti-Corruption Action Plan (2019-2020) and Open Government Partnership Action Plans in select municipalities.Improving state oversight through supporting the Parliament and the State Audit Office as well as building internal control functions of the government agencies... .
